utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I understand that you've had a cough, can you tell me a little bit more about that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so I've had this cough now, it's been going on for about two weeks, just, just hasn't gone away.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uhm, oK, can you tell me a little bit more about this cough? Is it dry or wet?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, yeah it's been, uhm, mix, it's been dry sometimes and I have had a little bit of sputum production recently, uh, it's been mostly clear though.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Has the cough gotten worse over the past two weeks?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, it's been about the same.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uhm, and have you had any blood that came up with the sputum?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't noticed any blood.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, what about any other symptoms over the past two weeks? Have you had, have you had any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. OK. And any uhm, I guess, any runny nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, my nose was a bit runny last week, but it's, that's better now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK, uhm, it's just, OK last week, what else, what other symptoms did you have last week?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I had a sore throat and a little bit of a headache as well, uhm, and, and some aches and fatigue. Those were uh, yeah, that was last week for about three days, and then I started to feel better. But I still have this cough, that, it's still going on.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So those other symptoms that you had last week that lasted about three days, are they all gone? are you still feeling fatigued or having a headache?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Those are both, yeah, they're gone.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Hmm, It's only the cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah I just have the cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Is there any time, any specific time of the day that it's worse or better? Anything that triggers it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, maybe like, maybe when I went out into the cold or, uhm, like, when I went for a run where I really kind of exerted myself, it brought it on, but other than those things, nothing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, but you're otherwise feeling better?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, for the most part, yeah, feeling better, but I still have a cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, have you had any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any palpitations? Do you feel like your heart's racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, no. Nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any other symptoms such as belly pain or diarrhea or Constipation or changes in your urine, are having any urinary symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't had anything like, like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK, and can you tell me about your past medical history, any medical conditions you have?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I, I'm healthy. I haven't, been diagnosed with, with anything.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK alright, any medications that you take including over the counter pills or any herbal pills or multi vitamins etc.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I'm taking a birth control.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see. OK, any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No allergies.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you have any, you don't have any lungs related diseases right? Like asthma or COPD or anything of that sort?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright alright, that's good,  and who do you currently live with, and where do you live?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Alright, so I live with a few roommates. I'm just finishing up my undergraduate degree.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, that's great. Have you had any contact with anyone who was sick recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I could think of, I mean we went out one night last week and that's kind of when I had those other symptoms for a few days after that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. Uhm and have you traveled outside the city or country?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, ok. Do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sometimes yeah, I, I will with friends, kind of socially.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: alright.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just a few drinks.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What about smoking?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, sometimes with, like socially with friends, but that might be once a month or probably even less.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, alright and any lung conditions that run in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uhm, OK alright, so that's all that I, I wanted to know. It sounds like you had a, you had a cold last week and you just have this residual cough that's still there, and it's been two weeks and you're just worried about it, but otherwise you're feeling well, you don't have any other symptoms. Often times when we get sick, or we have an infection or inflammation of the, uhm, the airway, we can get a cough that lasts a long time and it might just take you a couple more weeks for the cough to go away. But if you feel that it's getting any worse or you're, you have those symptoms come back again, or you develop a fever, we can, you can definitely, we can do something more about that. I'll also do a physical exam and, and see how you're doing and then we can go from there.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
